review_title: Fantastic Place to Work for PhD Graduates
pros:
- Excellent working environment.
- Good pay.
- You get to work on the very edge of "cutting-edge".
- If you are a recent PhD graduate, this is one of the few places you will get to conduct R&D work in the industry at a comparable level to what you were doing.
- Attractive performance-based bonuses, flexible remote work depending on your role.
- Managers are surprisingly friendly (depends on the individual of course, but my colleagues in other teams support this impression as well). I was expecting a much harsher environment before joining, to be frank.
cons: - The current geo-politics surrounding the company are the big elephant in the room, and will always be in the back of your head. Outlook past the next 1~2 years is a bit cloudy.

review_title: avoid unless to pay the bill
pros: good base salary if you negotiate well...
cons:
... that's it. 
- On Sales/channel sales package they will attract you with a good OTE, but everything is made so that you will only get 10-30% of variable part (crazy unrealistic goals)
-Non-sense daily requirements : take partners to restaurant again and again even if no business, ask for tens of partner certifications to be done ... just a non sense
-Bad atmosphere : good people don't stay, only mediocre people stay for years, "cowboy" atmosphere where everyone has to "name tag" themselves on others' accounts in CRM if they want to see revenue recognition... Huawei encourages it
-I can't even recommend for Junior/internships, even them leave for other companies if they can
-terrible reputation on the market - hugely due to "US Ban"- that makes your mission almost impossible. Very few partners/customers are open to work with Huawei nowadays

Avoid at all cost unless you need to pay the bills - which was my case - then continue searching for better opportunities

review_title: A very good organization with lot of challenges and actions to learn from and grow

1. Every member in the organization has equal opportunities based on their ability and area of interest.
2. Growth is purely defined and is based on Results and Value Additions made at the job.
3. Very good and collaborative work environment, strong support from the management provided we are vocal in sharing our issues and needs.
cons:
1. Should focus on localization of certain policies rather can monopolising to keep them in line with HQ policies as the benefits are different in different countries.
2. No strong channel to express the desires or improvements at work. There should be a channel and medium where members of the organization can openly share their thoughts with the management.

review_title: Lots of potential wasted through huge amount of bureaucracy
pros:
- High impact projects to work on
- Amazing people to work with
- People unfortunately care about names and prestige but having Huawei on your CV is really useful
cons:
- Insane amount of bureaucracy, kills the productivity big time
- The "China vs others" attitude and the fact that Chinese employees are worth more than the others (even outside of China)
- Language barrier with the Chinese employees (really difficult if you do not have a Chinese partner in your team/office)
- Sometimes you have to wait months to get permissions to access data and/or tools
- The tension between USA and China affects Huawei too and because of that, you are not allowed to use tools of "American origin"
- Most employees are overworked
- KPIs and other performance metrics for employees, teams, and departments can be unfair
- Constantly being bombarded by mandatory exams with tight deadlines
- Level system with no clear distinction between levels, resulting in better employees having lower levels than worse employees
- Salaries and benefits are not really great, especially the ones that are tied to the employee's level

1. You have the freedom to join the group you prefer if they are not against it.

cons:

pros:
1. Salary/perks are much above industry standards. Basically, they offer you so much that you don't refuse or leave easily.
2. Career growth is streamlined. No favoritism. Your perform, you get more perks and promotion.
3. Work profile is exceptional. You work on cutting edge tech and solution development. No run of the mill work.
4. Excellent workforce and colleagues. You get to learn so much from them. Most of them are with Huawei for 10+ years. Everyone is technical hands-on, even Managers and HR top echelons.
5. You are encouraged to publish papers/patents. New ideas are praised and awarded.

Online Huawei reviews are overwhelmingly bad. I don't know why it is like this. Maybe I am lucky to get into a good team with great work opportunities and good manager. Maybe others had it worse.

Joining Huawei turned out to be the right decision for me. The kind of tech and work I am exposed to is impossible to find at any other place.

review_title: Loads of opportunity to explore and learn and contribute.
pros:
The best place to start the career. Ample opportunity, challenges. Which no other company can provide. Depends on whether a person takes it as an opportunity/ experience or burden/pressure. 

Apart from regular work the company provides equal opportunity for every employee to learn contribute directly to the organization, ex : sharing ideas, learnings, brining in new practices, ideas to work on, all have the space to present ideas and file patents. 

In 1 stmt. It's an ocean of opportunities..... Sky is the limit for every individual on how much they can take up...
cons:
The peer pressure to perform is very high. The rewards and recognitions are not linear but exponential.. If u perform and get excellent  grades, then the rewards are also in line. But if u fall below in grades for what ever reason, the rewards also takes a hit.. If members are ready for both positive and negative side of it, then there are no other cons.

Pressure is always there, no company wants to pay employees for heating up the chair 😉

review_title: Professional and forward looking company with  a big space for innovation/ideas
pros:
- Extremely professional and well managed organization
- A very open cultured organization - employees can discuss, conceptualize and put forward just about any technical ideas
- Access to multiple avenues and forums to push forward innovative ideas
- Professional and objective approach towards research
- Performance oriented approach and the culture is such that everybody performs to their highest abilities
Even though its just been 3+ years for me here I can confidently say that Huawei is a leading employer and organization only due its working culture and professional and well thought out approach towards innovation. You get to work with the best minds and an opportunity to develop great software.

- I have read issues about working hours and deadlines, but then all great companies do have these. Ultimately if one can plan and pace the work, this is a non issue.
- Work and life balance well managed even during the pandemic times.
cons: No cons. Company culture orients employees to be skilled and professional.
